website_summaries.verdict: Large nut milk bag is the best way to make large quantities of milk for the whole family.
pros: Bags are available in packs of 1, 3, or 5
The fine nylon mesh easily filters out the pulp, leaving you with smooth, creamy milk
Bag is sturdy and can withstand plenty of stretching and pulling
The large bag is ideal for making nut milk for the whole family
cons: Drawstring doesn't draw the bag completely closed

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive journey to juicing
customer_reviews.text: I received my package today, and was very excited to unwrap. The product was secured and packaged nicely. Inside was a pamphlet with a couple of recipes and recommendations for use. The process was simple and easy to use and the quality of my juice experience was great with no pulp inside my glass, only juice. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to juice without the added equipment. The clean up was so easy. I’m glad I purchased this brand and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Craft

customer_reviews.title: Was nice until it started shrinking
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a nice bag, and worked great for straining my yogurt until is started shrinking. I had it less than a year and It no longer holds a gallon which is very frustrating for my yogurt making. I only hand washed, and always let it dry flat after washing. Update: I finally caved and got a new one because I couldn’t handle how small it was anymore. Look at the difference!! It’s crazy how much it shrunk.
customer_reviews.author: knik

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for thinning out your Smoothies
customer_reviews.text: I just received my bag and it already has improved the time it takes me to filter out the Thick muddy fiber from my daily smoothies. It takes me about 10 min in contrast to the previous hour it took me with competitor Filters. The Pro Quality Nut Milk Bag - Big 12"X12" is the perfect size for me and my smoothies. The bag is easy to clean except for the small debris that gets stuck in the outside seams.
customer_reviews.author: poochie2100

customer_reviews.title: Draw string does not stay tied!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag to strain nut milks. The actual straining was acceptable, but the plastic draw string slipped and came untied easily. Also, the bag was stiff and did not form around the contents. The bowl under the bag had to be the width of the bag to catch all drips. The bag came untied twice and fell, splash, into my drip bowl. So, a simple straining process grew to cleaning up whey splattered on me, the counter, and the wall. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for homemade yogurt
customer_reviews.text: I bought the nut milk bag to use on straining homemade yogurt which may said worked great. I found that it wanted alot of yogurt. The mesh is too big and yogurt goes right through it with the whet. I do better with a strainer and paper towels.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany J.

customer_reviews.title: Nut milk strainer = works; Yogurt strainer=not so much
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers said this could be used for straining yogurt which was my main purpose. I just ordered one last week and made 2 (1 gallon) each greek yogurt batches. I had previously been doing the process of filter (industrial size) and a colander so thought this would be easier. TOTAL FAIL for me. The yogurt went in easily and just poured right out. I don't know if they have changed the design or enlarged the size of the holes, since other users reviewed the product. I can make nut milks in it but I rarely do that. It works for its intended purpose but not mine
customer_reviews.author: Trogaroo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item twice so far with excellent results. The bag seems well constructed out of a stiff plastic mesh material, with a sewn in drawstring. Since I actually read and followed the instructions, I can confirm that the knead and squeeze method makes the task of filtering the almond flour from the milk fairly easy even for those with less hand strength. The milk produced had no noticeable pulp/flour/meal (whatever you would call it) Cleanup was made fairly easy by turning the bag inside out and rinsing, followed by a quick bath in regular dishwater.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Heavy use for 3 years and still going!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the price for a "piece of fabric", however I was so wrong! We use it to make cream cheese after making milk kefir , once the cream cheese is done we give the liquid left to our cats as an amazing source of nutrients! We then mix the cream cheese with different herbs and there you go! Tip: let the cream cheese sit with the herbs for a day let's say, to the flavours go stronger! cheers to health!
customer_reviews.author: MediaBoxEnt

customer_reviews.title: So happy I made this purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I don’t own a juicer but wanted to start celery juicing as I read a lot of benefits about it. I’m one to always read reviews prior to purchasing. These reviews were spot on! This was the one and only bag I purchased and I’m so happy I went with this specific one! This bag is durable and holds up nice. Juicing was so easy to do. You really get all the juice available and the pulp that remains in the bag is a dry like consistency; almost play-doh like. You can tell that you get every last drop. Rinsing and cleaning the bag is so easy and it’s fast drying. I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled for life with homemade almond milk!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first nut milk bag I’ve ever used, and I found it to work perfectly. The almond milk poured through it fast, and with a few squeezes the almond pulp was nearly dry. I am sure I will never drink store bought almond milk again! This was so easy and just took a few minutes to use. I used the enclosed recipe and I love it! By the way, you don’t need a vita mix or something fancy to make nut milk. I used a regular blender and it turned out fantastic. I used the leftover almond pulp to make delicious pancakes.
customer_reviews.author: Bugz D.

customer_reviews.title: Looks Fine but Don't Use It
customer_reviews.text: Just starting out to make Kefir at home, I bought this nut bag to see if it would be a good way to strain the Kefir from the grains. It looks fine - high quailty and all. But once I started straining the Kefir using a simple nylon mesh strainer, I decided to stick with that method. My concern with using this nut bag is that I'm not sure how to properly clean it between uses. For those who strain with this type of device, I am sure it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best!
customer_reviews.text: I've been making nut milk for a couple of years. I've tried different brands but these are simply the BEST. At the end of the "squeeze" the nut milk is totally pulp free. I used the last one I ordered for over 2 years. Just ordered again because I want to try them for straining my cold brew grounds and the second one will be used for straining the fruit pulp when making jelly. It is best to keep each bag for its dedicated task ... nut milk bag for nut milk, coffee bag for coffee, etc. I do advise watching her short videos ... they're very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: bkd'a

customer_reviews.title: Versatility
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of the bag and the suggested usages from the company. It is well made...the special netting to release the minimal amount of whey or other end results. I was given by Ellie, the recipe for making Almond Milk. and other nut milks. I just received the bag, took a while because I live in another country but I am very happy with it. Please note that I first heard about this bag while I was listening to a YouTube instruction on how to make homemade yogurt which I make in my Instant Pot...so I came to Amazon and bought one. thanks much Ellie
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the string pocket
customer_reviews.text: Primarily purchased to make horchata, but used it to rinse and squeeze out all the moisture from some frozen spinach. Bad idea. It got little flecks of spinach up in the pocket where the string lies and it’s been a beast trying to clean it out. I’ve slowly pulverized them by rubbing the material back and forth. I don’t know if there are easier to clean bags out there or if I even should have used it for that purpose, but it’s my least favorite feature that things can get trapped in there.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel O.

customer_reviews.title: Juicer not required!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to invest in a juicer.. there are some inexpensive ones that work pretty good but I have a small kitchen with limited space. I have the nutribullet combo blender and I love it! I thought why not use it as a juicer and have the best of both worlds! I used a colander at first to strain the juice from the pulp but this nutbag is better! Plus I make almond milk too. Great investment and so easy to clean. I may order another just so I can have two on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best I have used
customer_reviews.text: I use these nut milk bags to make a soft German cheese called Quark. After messes with cheesecloth and a different brand nut milk bag, I am happy to report that this brand is perfect. The curd and whey separate will. It’s not a fast process to dry the cheese, but with this bag it is easy. Cleaning is a breeze. The tip to turn the bag inside out makes cleanup simple. Nothing to get into seams. I rinse the bag, then use a little dishwashing detergent and rinse again. The bag dries very fast. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Magicweaver

customer_reviews.title: Been using for about a month and love it
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome. I've held off writing a review for a month to give it some use and it's great. Was worried it wouldn't be worth the price tag, but wow! Strong, durable, washes easy, and hasn't stained or contained odors so far. I mainly use it in conjunction to juicing vegetables in a blender and I am very pleased with its functionality. It honestly saved me $100+ on a juicer. Just my blender and this and I'm good to go in a relatively small amount of time every morning. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this one bag for almost 2 years and it's still going strong. Granted I don't make nut milk on a daily basis or even monthly for that matter. But anytime I do it does a great job of straining my homemade nut milks. It's easy to clean just warm soap and water and turn it inside out to clean it and make sure no residue is left. Let it air dry and store in drawer until I'm ready to use next time
customer_reviews.author: ChildofYah

customer_reviews.title: High quality and great value
customer_reviews.text: I am using this bag exclusively for cold brew coffee. It is of good quality. There have been no rips despite my pulling on it somewhat hard on occasion. My cold brew is delicious and I am certain the bag will serve all of its other purposes with distinction.
customer_reviews.author: David Rylak

customer_reviews.title: Very durable nut milk bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good nut milk bag. I’ve now used it a dozen times to make a few different but milks and it has held up nicely. I did notch out some material around the drawstring to allow some nut particles to flush out easier. This doesn’t affect the bag at all. I put a fair amount of strain on the bag material every time I use it and so far it’s held up fine. Clean this is fairly easy when I’m done squeezing the pulp. I dump out the contents and turn it inside out and rinse it off. I have put it in the dishwasher twice and it held up (top rack) just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Simon S.

customer_reviews.title: One of the most-used items in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I have no words for how much I love this bag. I use it to strain my cold-brewed coffee and tea. I also use it to remove the liquid from cucumbers when I make tzatziki, from potatoes when I make kugel and from greens when I juice them in my Vitamix (this is for when I'm too lazy to take out my masticating juicer). I always used cheesecloth which was difficult to clean and a pain to keep in place. This bag is just so much easier to use than cheesecloth and I love the wide mouth because it has eliminated so much mess.
customer_reviews.author: SAinVATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A five star product with a multitude of uses.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great investment for making nut milks. The full advantage for Herbalists in being able to squeeze Tinctures is quite remarkable. Before using this bag for tinctures, I made delicious Almond milk, checking to see how the bag would hold up. This is a five star product with a multitude of uses. Large, holds up to twisting and squeezing to extract a maximum amount of milk or tinctures. Cleans easily. I was surprised at how dry the almonds were after making the milk. I will definitely purchase more of these bags!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn G. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: so this bag is great at getting an extra 4-8oz of juice out of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to help get the last of the juice from the pulp left over from my juicer. I cannot justify spending $500 on a new juicer, so this bag is great at getting an extra 4-8oz of juice out of the left over pulp. When I finish juicing, the pulp is slightly damp, but after ringing it out in this bag it is as dry as can be! It does take a couple of minutes to really clean the pulp out after using it, but I the whole juicing process is time consuming for me. I definitely think this is worth the $9 and will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy nut milk bag
customer_reviews.text: I've only made almond milk so far using the nut milk bag. It's a fairly stiff bag on its own. But when you start pouring liquid into it, it is very easy to squeeze. I've seen videos where you have to wrap the other nut milk bags around the bowl; to hold it up; I havent' had to do that (not yet anyways; I've used it least 5-6 times within a month's time). The clean up is easy as well. And b/c it's stiff, I can have it standing upside down to dry. I like my nut milk bag so far!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Works but not meant for tiny kitchens.
customer_reviews.text: I probably bought the wrong bag for my very small kitchen. First time making almond milk and this worked but it's big. I'm doing small batches (3 cups of water and almonds) and it was awkward using this size bag. Wound up having to use it inside of a pitcher because I don't have any bowls big enough to accommodate something this size. I also don't have the workspace to lay the bag out and knead it like the company suggests. Not being an expert all I can say is that I could wring the bag as hard as I wanted, and it didn't tear or lose it's shape. It was easy to clean and dried very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Will O.

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: I've made coconut milk twice and almond milk once in the last 4 days. Homemade coconut milk is spectacular, I can't stop drinking it. The almond milk was delicious but gave me a stomach ache. Both were beautifully smooth. My throat hurt when I used cheesecloth before because I guess I didn't use enough and it was a little gritty. I really twisted the hell out of this bag to get every drop I could and it's holding up well. I plan on using it a lot so I'll update if it bursts at the seam. It seemed easy enough to clean. I turned it inside out and rinsed it well. It is wrinkled from the squeezing, but perfectly clean.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Pie

customer_reviews.title: Celery Bag
customer_reviews.text: Hello World! I really love these GREAT QUALITY nut bags. I watched a YouTube video on how to make my own celery juice at home. So I tried it using Ninja blender and this Nut Bag. I was in AWE! I'm now saving $5 on making my own Organic Celery Juice right in my own kitchen and it feels amazing. Just watch out for BUGS in Celery (YUK). These bags are pricy but worth it. I bought the 5 bags this time. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ateya

customer_reviews.title: ⭐️5 STARS⭐️
customer_reviews.text: 🔅AWESOME BAG🔅 🔹I used this bag to strain the dried ginger and lemon peels from the oil they had been soaking in 🔹This bag is quality made 🔹The ginger and lemon ALL stayed inside the bag and virtually all the oil was able to strain through 👉 You can see how “dry” the peels look after I squeezed the oil out 🔹This bad was extremely easy to clean. I literally rinsed in under water and all the peels washed off. Nothing got stuck in the bottom of the bag or the tiny holes. I’m making home made bone broth right now and this bag will be PERFECT for straining the broth from everything else!
customer_reviews.author: Em🐾

customer_reviews.title: One Of My Most Useful Purchases
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to use when making oat milk. I have had the same bag since Christmas and use it way more than I ever would have imagined. It is really durable and easy to clean. If you buy this bag, you will wonder how you have lived your life this long without one. I know I did. I definitely will be buying this again....but for now it is still going strong with no need for a new one in sight!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not the best bang for your buck but works!
customer_reviews.text: I used this filter for my cold brew coffee grounds for about under a year and it’s done the job fairly well. This product does have some design flaws however as it still aloes lots of coffee sediment through the filter despite me using the coarsest grounds possible. Also grounds can get stuck in the opening for the draw string and are nearly impossible to remove during cleaning leaving you with rotting grounds stuck in your filter making it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Renzo

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Drinking celery juice every am I was using cheesecloth and my vitamix. Cheesecloth just wasn’t doing it. Got this nut bag and it’s amazing. So easy to clean, strains amazing!! Just dried pulp left in bag. Air drys so quick. I will be re ordering another one. If you juice and don’t want to buy another gadget for the kitchen. Use your blender and this bag!!!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: OMG need a better name LOL
customer_reviews.text: Yeah so real quick story. I was shopping on amazon and asked the wife if she needed anything before I finished the order. She said yes, but then told me not to laugh. I said okay. So she told me what she needed, a quality nut bag. I looked at her with a confused yet amusing look. It just went downhill from there. I mean come on the inventors in general could not think of a better name? Constant jokes led to multiple slaps and dead legs. Anyway, she loves the product. Makes her own almond milk and all. She is very happy with it. But its a constant competition :P
customer_reviews.author: Chris J

customer_reviews.title: Makes Greek Yogurt
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an Instant Pot last year and make greek yogurt twice a month, I had been using coffee filters before I realized this bag was a thing and O M G did this save me a ton of time!!!! SO worth it!!! I've made yogurt about 6 times so far since I've had this bag and no tears, holes, or issues whatsoever. Easy to hand clean and use again. It only strains out the whey and doesn't let any of the yogurt drip through. If you need it for that reason, BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make paneer. Every recipe said that you had to use a cheesecloth. Well, this led into several failed attempts where the paneer would stick to the cloth or the cloth just became a soggy mess. This bag worked perfectly! The material is sturdy and held the paneer without becoming too limp. It was easy to squeeze the excess liquid out without losing any of the yummy stuff. And then... it was super easy to clean and store away in the kitchen. I can’t wait to explore what else I can make with this bag such as almond milk. I will never buy cheesecloth again!
customer_reviews.author: Tarbeikoh

customer_reviews.title: Practically perfect
customer_reviews.text: Edit: my five star review for a nut milk bag is being used for dog cbd? I refuse to reward that kind of bait and switch I tried to be all earth-friendly, and get a set of organic cotton nut milk bags. It didn’t matter whether I was making almond milk, soymilk or oat milk. The pores of the bag got clogged immediately, and I’d spend twenty minutes trying to squeeze the milk through. Forget that. This bag is SO much easier, but still strains the milk beautifully. It’s large enough to handle a whole batch, and sturdy enough that it’s already held up to dozens of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea G

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this. I hate using cheesecloth, and I thought this was going to be my answer. My plan was to use it for straining things like "fire cider" and elderberry tincture. My first use was ginger extract. I was able to use it one more time before cleaning it became unreasonable. Little bits of ginger and berry get stuck in the seam, and have to be picked out one by one. I can't even fathom using it for ground nuts, unless the natural oils help them release more easily. It's a great idea, but something has to be done about the seams. Surely there's a better way.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Short

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved mine so much that I bought some for gifts. The almond milk tastes so much better than store bought. No preservatives or plastic bottle waste. I've used the almond pulp as meal for muffins. I'm going to try crackers next. I bought a 3# bag of raw almonds and I've made about 7 quarts of almond milk with enough almonds left to make appoximately 2-3 more batches. Definitely cheaper than store bought!
customer_reviews.author: Keri EB

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Juicer Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Love my nut milk bag! Have yet to use the bag to make nut milk as I solely have used this bag to make celery juice! I do not have a juicer so this bag is a great cost efficient alternative to making the juice! After blending chopped celery in my blender, I use this nut bag to strain the mixture. Voila! Perfect delicious celery juice! Would highly recommend trying this method! Bag is also easy to clean and dries quickly. Buy this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great company
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product, exacty as described. Highly recommended. Ellie's Best also dealt with a concern I had - there was a shipping error that made receiving the Nut Milk bag inconvenient and very late - they responded to my complaint IMMEDIATELY, and, even though they weren't responsible for the problem (that was Amazon Fulfillment), they helped me ensure it would not reoccur, and gave me a credit for my trouble. This is an excellent company, with an excellent product and their customer service is first-rate. Unhesitatingly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: This has made me look forward to making homemade nut milk. Before I was using cheesecloth and it was such a mess; it worked to strain, but then the nut pulp stuck so much in the cheesecloth and was wasted or if I tried to get it out of the cheesecloth, scattered everywhere. This bag is so effective and easy to use. Big high five for manufacturing this! THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Aufgeiler

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use...and great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I was astonished to find out how easy it is to make really delicious almond milk with this nut bag. There’s just no difficulty at all in separating the milk from the solids left in the bag. Not only that, Ellie’s Best immediately sent me a replacement when I noticed two tiny holes in the first bag I received. The fresh almond milk tastes WAY better than any I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Grady

customer_reviews.title: straining celery
customer_reviews.text: Bag works well - my wife and I are drinking celery juice so we blend 4 whole celery and use a ninja blender and then use nut bag to separate the bulk and juice. Works well...used 2 whole celery for approximately 16 oz per person. Thanks If your juicing you need a "PRO QUALITY NUT MILK BAG" we couldn't juice without our nut milk bag using a mixer. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne D. White

customer_reviews.title: Best Nut Bag so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've been making homemade almond milk for nearly 20yrs. For the fIrst few years I used cheesecloth, pinching it together myself - what a pain, and what a mess. Then I tried the Chinois - easier, but lots of work to push it through the tiny holes. Then I used a then-new nut milk bag - revolutionary! But now - THIS nut milk bag is indeed BIGGER and so much BETTER!! it's sturdy, easy to knead the milk through the mesh, and big! I make a lot of almond milk at a time... and it's easy to clean. Thank you for this major upgrade!! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Holistic Nut

customer_reviews.title: Deserves to be top rated!
customer_reviews.text: I've been making my own almond milk for years and tried this instead of the organic cotton bag that came with my blender a year ago. Wish I'd had this much sooner as it is SO EASY to use and clean. Separates out the nut material from liquid beautifully, but is much easier to squeeze, wash, and dry- takes about 10 min to air dry and I can put it away! My old bag had to sit overnight. Plus I can see when it is completely rinsed out. I appreciate this every week I make my almond milk.
customer_reviews.author: Mumsers

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: Large opening to pour in pulp and liquid. The mesh netting is excellent quality and very sturdy. The seems are sewn well with no ends of the thread hidden. This product is much better than the previous product we had been using. Very easy to clean too. The material doesn't wrinkle like our previous but bag. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: Great for Oat Milk
customer_reviews.text: Used primarily for making oat milk. This bag has already paid for itself. I can now make a quart of oat milk from organic oats, additive free, for about 36 cents rather than paying almost $3 for 2 quarts. Easy to use, cleans up easily thanks to it's thoughtful design. The tips and recipes are very helpful. This is a great kitchen tool and health investment. Health is precious; staying healthy is far less expensive than dr. visits and drug therapy.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Zippy

customer_reviews.title: The netting is not fine enough for filtering wine during the racking process and ...
customer_reviews.text: The netting is not fine enough for filtering wine during the racking process and the bag had a strong chemical smell out of the box. I had to wash the bag several times for the smell to go away. It left with an uneasy feeling that chemicals were leeching into my wine. Fortunately, it is not fine enough a filter for my purposes, so I won't be using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Magic Mike

customer_reviews.title: Pro Quality Nut Milk Bag - Big 12"X12"
customer_reviews.text: The quality of construction seems fine, it's the application that I don't care for. I bought this after seeing that some people liked it for straining their homemade yogurt, to get Greek yogurt. It strains just fine, but what a mess trying to get the strained yogurt out of the bag! And there's no convenient way to hang the bag over a dish in the refrigerator, to make the draining more effective and less hands on. I'm going to try a metal mesh strainer lined with cheesecloth. I'm hoping that this will be a more effective and less messy way to get the results I want.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: This bag is the most!!
customer_reviews.text: I Love this milk bag. I have been making Brazil Nut milk now once a week and this bag has saved me valuable time. I use to use cheese cloth before purchasing this bag and it was slow and more messy. I am delighted with this bag, it is strong and very east to clean. I would recommend it to anyone who makes their own milk.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well designed
customer_reviews.text: The nut milk bag is working great. Easy to wring out the liquid, easy to clean and it seems very sturdy. I bought it on the recommendation of my sister who has had hers for about a year and she says it's holding up extremely well and she uses it a lot. I have a good feeling mine will do the same. The seller also has excellent, short videos with tips on making almond milk and other beverages and you can even use it for straining the pulp from green drinks. Haven't tried that yet but I will.
customer_reviews.author: Palmia

customer_reviews.title: THE Best Nut Milk Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is my third nut milk bag and my favorite one of all three. I love the mesh and how quickly the "milk" strains through this bag. The other two bags I had were more fabric-like and it took forever to strain my milk. This is also much easier to wash and dry. I love how easy it is to use and how delicious homemade almond milk is. This will be the only bag I ever use.
customer_reviews.author: Plants On Purpose

customer_reviews.title: Very strong bags.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these bags for myself and my mother. They’re quite sturdy and they get the job done. We’re both juicers and mom is a raw vegan so use the heck out of these bags on an almost mundane basis.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Trotman

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: Quality Product! I am using this to make cashew milk and the finer mesh of this filtration bag did an incredible job. It was fast and easy and I did not have to use a lot of pressure to get the job done. Cleanup was very fast; I washed by hand and did not have any problems with small particles getting stuck in the seams.
customer_reviews.author: cjh

customer_reviews.title: Great Nut Milk Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these bags. They may be more expensive than other nut milk bags but the quality of these bags are great. I’ve been using mine for about a year and is still in great shape, no holes or rips... Just bought 2 more .. 1 to start juicing (using a blender) and 1 just as an extra. I haven’t bought any of the other bags for sale, but I don’t want to waste money on cheaper bags if the quality is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Drunkbunny2u

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy and well-constructed bag. I’ve been using it to create small batches of fresh fruit juice by blending juice in a blender and then straining the pulp using this bag. I was worried that the bag wouldn’t be able to stand up to the vigorous wringing and squeezing, but in fact it seems to be designed and constructed for just such handling.
customer_reviews.author: Elemeno

customer_reviews.title: Durable super fine strainer
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement purchase. I original bought one many years ago and although it still functions and is in great shape I thought it was time for a clean replacement. Excellent for straining liquid cannibis product for medicinals. Very fine strainer and heat resistant along with durability.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Vakas

customer_reviews.title: Great for Greek Yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: Great for straining homemade yogurt into thicker "Greek" yogurt. I rest a colander on top of a bowl, and set the nut bag inside the colander. I can fit a whole gallon of yogurt into this bag (it's admtitedly a bit of a stretch). In about 3 hours, the yogurt has reduced by about 1/3, which is the thickness I desire. *So much* cheaper than the alternative gizmos that are advertised for this purpose, and I'm guessing it's just as durable; and it takes up about zero space in the cupboard. I just hand-wash the bag, really easy (rinse off all the milky bits with cold water first). I might even try nut milk now that I have this!
customer_reviews.author: M. Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I love using this nut milk bag. I use it to make oat milk all the time, and it strains very well. I also appreciate that it is sent to you inside out and contains directions to use it that way. This makes it really easy to rinse out and clean. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Rae

customer_reviews.title: More Efficient Than A Juicer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Works fully as advertised in half the time, as opposed to a juicer. I use it to make celery juice every single day. Easy to clean. Quick tip from the seller's (Ellie's Best) Amazon video: dry the cleaned bag by putting a dinner plate inside and putting it in a dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know what I was missing!
customer_reviews.text: I've been making my almond milk using cheesecloth. Then I stumbled on these milk bags on Amazon and things got crazy! These milk bags are so easy to use! I never loose a bunch of almond meat in the sink, and I am able to squeeze so much more liquid out of them! I highly recommend! They will make life so easy! Super easy clean up! Now I make almond milk every other day! Love love love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: I've just came back to purchase a spare bag. First purchase was a year ago. I've tried several different bags since I first purchased this one and there is absolutely no comparison to the quality and ease of use and cleaning. It also works the best with all of my nut milks.
customer_reviews.author: NotSoGranola

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not fine enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for green juice, and it just slowly but surely releases the pulp back into the juice, it kind of works for filtering the pulp out the second time I do it when the juice natually seperates after sitting in my fridge for a day. I am still looking for a more effective strainer or bag that will hold all of the pulp and release the good juice
customer_reviews.author: Jake Renolds

customer_reviews.title: worked well
customer_reviews.text: my first time making coconut milk and this bag made it quite easy to squeeze and strain the milk from the shredded coconuts, took less than 5mins to do and the shredded coconuts were almost completely dry.. Only issue i had was with string, it is so long that it kept getting in my way. think i need a smaller bag for my needs though so off to see if Ellie's have one. Can't comment on ebook helpfulness, not sure where it is at yet. oh do like the little booklet thingie that came with bag, the essential oil percentages part will come in handy for when i don't want to do the math!
customer_reviews.author: Casper & BooTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great for making cream cheese!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make cream cheese and I loved it! It was my first time trying to make cream cheese and this product worked really well, in fact, I think it makes a great substitution any time you're on the fence about using cheesecloth. It's tighter weaved and easy to clean. I'm sure it works really well for all kinds of things and I'm sure I'll come up with more options down the road.
customer_reviews.author: JwHw

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye cheesecloth, HELLO lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone currently using cheesecloth to make your nut milk, this will change your life! I’ve been using cheesecloth for years making almond milk since no other nut milk bag has worked. Then I met this bag and I am hooked. It strains perfectly leaving no pulp in the milk and clean up, no joke, is a total breeze. My whole process and counter was clean in 5 mins. And it fits over the blender perfectly for drying. I debated on this purchase because, as noted, other bags were just a clean up nightmare and left milk still in the pulp. Not so with this bag. I would buy again and again and give 10 stars if possible!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: I'm making my own milk!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the nut milk bag for the first time today and I love it! The milk came out perfect, there were no nut pieces floating in it. It was very easy to clean as well. It was also nice and helpful to receive the nut soak chart as well. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Celery juice is awesome with this bag!
customer_reviews.text: My wife struggled making celery juice with our large and cumbersome juicer that is a pain to put together and clean. So we bought these bags and tried making celery juice with our Vitamin blender, and it turned out awesome. Best of all, its easy to use (exactly like the owner has in her YouTube videos) and a snap to clean. We now don't need to deal with our juicer - the blender and milk bag does it all. We will be buying these for family members.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Results But Seams Get Moldy
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag for over a year and though I'm pleased with the strained milk, the seam that holds the drawstring gets moldy. Despite scrubbing it down, it seems nearly impossible to clean. I've even tried to pull the string out front under the material as much as possible, but the black soot just won't come out - Perhaps it just needs to be replaced yearly.
customer_reviews.author: hfer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this product once so far, but was very happily surprised with the ease of use, cleaning, and its overall effectiveness. I have tried to make various nut milks in cheesecloth with varying degrees of success. This seems like a sturdy and reliable product that will make me much more likely to make such milks on a regular basis. Also interested in trying out cheese and yogurt making with this.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa LoCoco

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at an automatic nut milk maker, but at $200-400, it was going to hurt my wallet. Since I already have a vitamix, I decided to try the nut milk bag instead. It works! It works really well! It's easy to get the milk through and it beautifully filters the milk, leaving the nut fragments behind in the bag. It's very easy to clean and is constructed well. My kids are really enjoying the milk I can make, especially the cashew milk.
customer_reviews.author: Charity A Nix

customer_reviews.title: Great for all sorts of things
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I've lent it to a friend, who has used it to make horchata. I've used it to strain yogurt and kefir. The large size makes it easy to clean. I just scrunch it up with some soapy water, blast it well with the kitchen sprayer, and hang by the string to dry. I've never had anything get stuck in the seams, and kefir grains can get pretty small!
customer_reviews.author: Hermione Danger

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I started juicing celery and this nut milk bag is fantastic at separating the juice from the fiber!! Very easy to clean. I bought one for a friend, she was using a strainer for her celery juice. She said her nut milk bag doubled the amount of juice.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: small strain holes
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make my almond and cashew milk and it’s GREAT. I strain my but milk through 2-3x like i would any other because I like the silky smooth texture, most people don’t care. This has been the best but milk bag by far. the strain holes are so small that it keeps all the pulp in. once you learn your technique you’re good to go!
customer_reviews.author: karyn

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time this weekend to make some refrigerator elderberry tea without having to boil, babysit, & strain. Threw in the ingredients and left it overnight. By the next day or so, it was just what I was hoping for. It was easy to dump and rinse the bag. It seems like it's drying well. I'm excited.
customer_reviews.author: Megan King

customer_reviews.title: ... first time I've ever attempted to use a bag like this. I have just recently began making almond ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've ever attempted to use a bag like this. I have just recently began making almond milk and if I knew how easy it would be, I would have made my own a long time ago! This bag is awesome. I blend up the nuts, water, and vanilla and this bag lets me easily squeeze out the milk and it holds the pulp. It's a fine mesh so the milk is really creamy and no pieces get into the milk. This is a quality bag with double stitching along the seams. It's easy to wash out and it dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: happy mommy

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME product!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this nut bag to make my son’s almond milk and oat milk two to three times a week for six months now. It does a fantastic job and has held up so well! It’s still going strong, even after all that use. Some tips: Take the drawstring out if you don’t need it. Turn it inside out to use it. The inside hem just collects debris from whatever you’re straining and it’s kind of a pain to clean. If you use it inside out, it rinses out much easier! I just rinse mine well, wash with some Mrs. Meyer’s dish soap, rinse again and hang to dry.
customer_reviews.author: justcruzn

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well for cold brew
customer_reviews.text: I just used my nut milk bag for the first time to strain cold brew. I followed the suggestion of kneading the coffee grounds rather than squeezing and that seemed to work well. The bag caught probably 99% of the grounds, with only a few grams (out of 450 grams) of the finest grounds making it through. Those sunk to the bottom of my mason jar, so all I had to do was pour the cold brew out and rinse out the sludge on the bottom. The bag was also very easy to rinse clean with nothing more than water. I hung it up to line dry and it is ready to use again. Great product! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: David Schonberger

customer_reviews.title: Great, Hand Wash Inside Out
customer_reviews.text: I've used these but bags every single day for over a year, sometimes twice a day to make all different types of juices/milks/teas...celery juice, apple juice, cucumber juice, almond milk, herbal teas. They work perfectly. I've found it best to clean by washing with soap and water inside out (to get any food stuck in the seam) and then use right side out. One of my bags got stained from a really really potent tea I made, but other than that they've worked perfect for over a year of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: TYL11

customer_reviews.title: I Use the Bag for Spelt Milk
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bag. Versus nut milk, I've used it for spelt milk and other oat milk. It sifts very well, without residue filtering through to the "clean" milk. The only issue that I've had is cleaning the bag afterwards. It can be challenging to get all the oat residue out. I've been letting it dry partially cleaned and then wiping it down a bit more. I'm conflicted between 4 and 5 stars because technically the bag is a nut milk bag, so perhaps the cleaning issue would not be an issue if I used it for nuts only, lol.
customer_reviews.author: B Mc

customer_reviews.title: Nice for iced coffee
customer_reviews.text: Works great for making iced coffee. Let's a little bit of finely ground coffee through the bag and it settles in the bottom. The last glass of coffee is a little bit gritty because of it. However, without putting in a lot more work and spending more time/money I think that will happen regardless. Course ground coffee (like for a French press) would also probably help.
customer_reviews.author: Matt in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Making almond milk and flour has never been easier
customer_reviews.text: This bag is wonderful. Because of Whole30 diet, I've making my own hazelnut and almond milk. It is just so easy using this bag. Easily catches the pulp which I then bake and use for flour. My husband who doesn't like nut milk, likes my homemade using this bag. It washes so easily. At first I was leaving pulp in, but removing with this and using it for flour has been an absolute winner.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Does their job
customer_reviews.text: These do their job quite nicely. I've used to both make almond milk and to remove pulp from homemade juice and they work quite well for both. The mesh used is so fine, clean up is very easy. I just turn it inside out and spray off the pulp. Pretty good item!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: As many jokes as you can make with a product called a nut bag...this is great. I use it for all kinds of things, not just squeezing crushed nuts. I use it to rinse my rice or anything else that needs rinsing and isn’t delicate. It’s easy to clean so I often use it instead of a colander if I can. I used it to make horchata! Mmm..very good. And its great quality too, really sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: E_Gonza

customer_reviews.title: Makes milking my nuts a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve heard great things about this bag and it’s really lived up to the hype so far! I’ve used it to make oat milk and well as cold brew coffee, and it made the process SO MUCH EASIER than struggling with cheesecloth and coffee filters. It’s even easier than my French press! It also cleans up so easily— nothing gets caught in the seams or sticks to the sides that’s not easily rinsed away. My cold brew did stain it a tiny bit, but that’s purely cosmetic and not a fault. I love this thing, and will definitely be repurchasing if and when the time comes!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the nut bags for a couple weeks now and even though I've only made almond milk so far, I'm very happy with the quality and ease of use with these bags. I will try other milks and probably cold-pressed coffee too. Bags are sturdy, easy to clean and I love the fact that the seams are on the outside. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Dani Musso

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, sturdy nut bag!
customer_reviews.text: This nut bag can withstand what seems like endless twisting from my boyfriend and me trying to get every last drop. I bought this nut bag originally to separate cannabis from my infused oil. It worked amazingly! I bought 3 more bags because I wanted to use it for other products. I now use it to separate flaxseeds from their gel, which I use to make a homemade hair gel. I have not used it for nut milk yet but I plan on making oat milk and walnut milk very soon! You can use this bag to replace anything you use cheese cloth for.
customer_reviews.author: Julie R.

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Nut Milk Bag! I have not used it to make nut milk though I may in the future. I have used it every day since I received it to make celery juice. Now in stead of using my juicer which takes longer and leaves me with several parts to wash after use I now put my celery in my vitamix and then strain it through my nut milk bag. Works like a charm so easy to rinse out to clean it! The old nut milk bags I used in the past were never this easy to use and clean! Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: F. V.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE it! I have been using cheesecloths and it was beginning to be expensive. I decided to try this nut milk bag out and to my surprise it was 10x than using the cheesecloths. When I squeezed my celery through the cheesecloth, the pulp would seep through. Not with this bag. I believe I am able to get more juice w/ the squeeze. After use, I wash it and let it air dry on the dish-rack and it's ready to use the next day. Thank you, Ellie's Best for making a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Aixa Soriano

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love this.... have made several batches already but since it's just me and I don't want it to spoil I just do 1/4 cup of almonds to 1 cup of water. It still makes a lot of pulp to dry for flour. SO very easy to do and use.
customer_reviews.author: lincbode

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I've had the nut milk bag for about a month, but just started using it. I use it, exclusively, for making cold brew coffee. It has streamlined the process and made clean-up much faster and easier. It's a well made, quality product that would highly recommend for making cold brew coffee. Should it wear out, or something happen to it, I would buy another one, immediately. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Outlander

customer_reviews.title: Great for Straining Water Out of Cauliflower Dough
customer_reviews.text: I use this to strain my cauliflower dough and it works perfectly! Before, I used a cloth material (it was a cheese-cloth bag type of deal); because cloth is stretchy, when I squeezed to strain water from the dough, some of the dough would penetrate through. As stated in the description, this product is made of a nylon-mesh material; when I used this on my cauliflower dough, only water came out; this strains out liquids more efficiently, which made my cauliflower dough come out better after baking. :)
customer_reviews.author: Juliana

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Easy to Use, & Exactly What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: What elevated this nut milk bag (which we use for brewing cold coffee, straining shredded potatoes and zucchini, and so much more) is the AMAZING customer service. The nut milk bag from Ellie's Best feels like it came from your best friend, meaning that they include an added bonus book of recipes, they're enthusiastic and genuine in their follow-up, and they're truly interested in if the bag is working for you or not. (Meaning they have amazing copywriters and are crushing it!) I'm definitely keeping my eye on the brand now for other products they sell, just for the experience of buying from them.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Leaves

customer_reviews.title: Works great for homemade almond milk
customer_reviews.text: I use this nut bag for making homemade almond milk. It works great. Since I don’t use it for anything else I just rinse it with water and make sure to clean the almond plum to prevent any molding. I’ve used it since last November. So far no issues. Great size as well as I make about 4-5 cups of milk at a time. Read the little booklet attached on how to better squeeze out the milk. This technique helps a lot! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: High quality product!
customer_reviews.text: High quality product! The mesh is very fine and you get 2 little recipe books with you purchase. One book arrives with the mesh, the second one is a download, and you can find the link in the your first recipe book. I can’t wait to make some milk/cheese!
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Waldman

customer_reviews.title: I. Am. Impressed. Period.
customer_reviews.text: I. Am. Impressed. Period. The best nut bag I’ve ever had. Made some delicious pistachio milk first and it is SO smooth with no pulp grains in the milk. With the other nut bags I had —the pulp would push through the cloth but not with this one. No complaints whatsoever. I will definitely get some more. Get. These.
customer_reviews.author: Laurice Kessler

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen gadgets!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean...I can get a every last drop and the use the pulp for many uses as well. If its juice I am making, the pulp makes great crackers. If its nut milk, the pulp makes a great flower for baking. I am vegan and use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Trina Tuel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but stiff
customer_reviews.text: It’s very sturdy but I would have preferred a softer, more pliable material. This is very hard and stiff. I can’t squeeze it very well and it’s hard to clean throughly, even when machine washed.
customer_reviews.author: Tomi

customer_reviews.title: Homemade Oat Milk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for making homemade oat milk and has been a great help. Easy to use, the oats sometimes get stuck under the drawstring seam but turn it inside out and clean, small price to pay for such a good product
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Strains well and high quality
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews that said it was easier to strain and they were right. Still a beginner in strainer and making My own juices and nut milks, but good quality product and I had other brands to compare it too, so this one was the best and easiest to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Gibb

customer_reviews.title: Cold Brew Coffee Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: No more tedious triple straining of coffee grounds! I was able to pour the cold brew coffee directly into the container to put in the fridge without having to strain and still having small grounds left in the brew. The only downside is the very fine grounds got through the mesh bag, but it was NOTHING compared to all the work of straining it to bottle up. I plan to purchase another to have on hand for yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Lopez
